intro: Agalinis meyeniana, commonly known as the narrowleaf false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and disturbed soils, often in association with other herbaceous plants. Its flowers are tubular and usually pink or purple, with two lips, and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its slender leaves and is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats.
